R: @dhalperi

I have successfully run the `RunnableOnService` tests on the Dataflow runner. I expect postcommit to be happy with this one.

It turns out the fairly simple NPE in Spark (fixed in the first commit here) was the only thing left.
I went ahead and checked out the commit that only adds the test, and sure enough it fails. I don't quite know what to make of the CI result there.

You're fast :-)

I'll wait for Scott's LGTM before merging.
Sorry for being nosy, just browsing PRs. Is #438 the change referred to here?

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

Awesome! 
BTW how did you get pass tests that use `Read.from`  ?

I worked with @orian and finally found the remaining bug. The problem was that we were using normalized key sorting in Flink which is incompatible with some coders, such as `AvroCoder`. I've disabled it and now the test program works. I'll wait for @orian to confirm and then merge this.

Ah, of course: they are now separated into the various sdks/io modules. So everything in sdks/core (Create, TextIO, ...) is handled specially by the spark runner.

Still, a great step. We would have arrived at the same point by using test categories to filter, but this is convenient.

This reminds me: I think the capability matrix suggests the Read.from transform is implemented, so we should update that.
LGTM
in the Source API section ? true. I think I didn't really get this one at first..
There are tests failure in the DirectRunner due to the latest changes and rebase. I will fix that.

Hi JB!

One small request:
- Please don't rebase every time. It's much easier to review if you simply add new incremental CLs to the existing pull request, as this way I can see what changed ;) (This is mentioned briefly in the [contribution guide](http://beam.incubator.apache.org/contribution-guide/#code-review-and-revision), but is not obvious and may not be standard practice everywhere).

I checked out your PR and tried to get the tests to pass -- but I was never able to make both the single-file and multi-file tests pass. I think that right now the ZipInputStream does not automatically concat all file contents without more effort. Might need to make a new class that wraps the ZipInputStream and manually calls `getNextEntry` whenever the current entry reaches EOF.
Merged. Congrats on the first PR!
Thank you Davor. Closing.
(No need to close yourself. @asfgit will do it automatically.)
Thank you, won't close it manually next time.
